name: Redis
description:
The Redis connector allows you to access the Redis commands through the WSO2 EI. Redis is an open source (BSD licensed), in-memory data structure store, used as a database, cache and message broker. It supports data structures such as strings, hashes, lists, sets, sorted sets with range queries, bitmaps, hyperloglogs and geospatial indexes with radius queries.
In latest version we have added following:
Previously we were creating a single pool for each cluster operation and closing it after each operation that's why read/write lock issue occurs (jmxRegister and jmxUnRegister on the same object). This Pr rectifies that and also avoids closing JedisCluster after each operation since It's no need to close the JedisCluster instance as it is handled by the JedisClusterConnectionPool itself.

Also introduced the "isJmxEnabled" property to enable JMX if required.

operations.name: init
operations.description: configure Redis connector

operations.name: echo
operations.description: echo the given string

operations.name: ping
operations.description: ping the server

operations.name: quit
operations.description: close the connection

operations.name: hDel
operations.description: delete one or more hash fields

operations.name: hExists
operations.description: determine if a hash field exists

operations.name: hGet
operations.description: get the value of a hash field

operations.name: hGetAll
operations.description: get all the fields and values in a hash

operations.name: hIncrBy
operations.description: increment the integer value of a hash field by the given number

operations.name: hKeys
operations.description: get all the fields in a hash

operations.name: hLen
operations.description: get the number of fields in a hash

operations.name: hMGet
operations.description: get the values of all the given hash fields

operations.name: hMSet
operations.description: set multiple hash fields to multiple values

operations.name: hSet
operations.description: set the string value of a hash field

operations.name: hSetnX
operations.description: set the value of a hash field, only if the field does not exist

operations.name: hVals
operations.description: get all the values in a hash

operations.name: del
operations.description: delete a key

operations.name: exists
operations.description: determine if a key exists

operations.name: expire
operations.description: set a key's time to live in seconds

operations.name: expireAt
operations.description: set the expiration for an existing key as a UNIX timestamp

operations.name: keys
operations.description: find all keys matching the given pattern

operations.name: randomKey
operations.description: return a random key from the keyspace

operations.name: rename
operations.description: rename a key

operations.name: renamenX
operations.description: rename a key, only if the new key does not exist

operations.name: ttl
operations.description: get the time to live for a key

operations.name: type
operations.description: determine the type stored at key

operations.name: blPop
operations.description: remove and get the first element in a list or block until one is available

operations.name: brPop
operations.description: remove an get the element in a list or block one is available

operations.name: lInsert
operations.description: insert an element before or after another element in a list

operations.name: lLen
operations.description: get a length of a list

operations.name: lPop
operations.description: remove and get the first element in a list

operations.name: lPush
operations.description: prepend one or multiple values to a list

operations.name: lPushX
operations.description: prepend a value of an element in a list by its index

operations.name: lRange
operations.description: get a range of elements from a list

operations.name: lRem
operations.description: remove element from a list

operations.name: lSet
operations.description: set the value of an element in a list by it's index

operations.name: lTrim
operations.description: trim a list to the specified range

operations.name: rPopLPush
operations.description: remove the list element in a list, prepend it to another list and return it

operations.name: rPush
operations.description: append one or more multiple values to a list

operations.name: rPushX
operations.description: append a value to a list, only if the list exists

operations.name: flushAll
operations.description: delete all the keys of all the existing databases

operations.name: flushDB
operations.description: delete all the keys of the currently selected database

operations.name: sadd
operations.description: add one or more members to a set

operations.name: sDiffStore
operations.description: subtract multiple sets and store the resulting set in a key

operations.name: sInter
operations.description: intersect multiple sets

operations.name: sInterStore
operations.description: intersect multiple sets and store the resulting set in a key

operations.name: sIsMember
operations.description: determine if a given value is a member of a set

operations.name: sMembers
operations.description: get the all members in a set

operations.name: sMove
operations.description: move a member from one set to another

operations.name: sPop
operations.description: remove and return one or multiple random members from a set

operations.name: sRandMember
operations.description: get one or multiple random members from a set

operations.name: sRem
operations.description: remove one or more members from a set

operations.name: sUnion
operations.description: add multiple sets

operations.name: sUnionStore
operations.description: add multiple sets and store the resulting set in a key

operations.name: zadd
operations.description: add one or more members to a sorted set or update its score if it already exist

operations.name: zCount
operations.description: count the members in a sorted set with scores within the given values

operations.name: zIncrBy
operations.description: increment the score of a member in a sorted set

operations.name: zInterStore
operations.description: intersect multiple sorted sets and store the resulting stored set in a new key

operations.name: zRange
operations.description: return a range of members in a sorted set by index

operations.name: zRangeByScore
operations.description: return a range of members in a sorted set by score with scores ordered from high to low

operations.name: zRank
operations.description: determine the index of a member in a sorted set

operations.name: zRem
operations.description: remove one or more members from a sorted set

operations.name: zRemRangeByRank
operations.description: remove all members in a sorted set within the given indexes

operations.name: zRemRangeByScore
operations.description: remove all members in a sorted set within the given scores

operations.name: zRevRange
operations.description: return a range of members in a sorted set by index with scores ordered from high to low

operations.name: zRevRangeByScore
operations.description: return a range of members in a sorted set by score with score ordered form high to low

operations.name: zRevRank
operations.description: determine the index of a member in a sorted set with scores ordered from high to low

operations.name: zScore
operations.description: get the score associated with the given member in a sorted set

operations.name: zUnionStore
operations.description: add multiple stored sets and store the resulting stored set in a new key

operations.name: append
operations.description: append a value to a key

operations.name: decrBy
operations.description: decrement the integer value of key by the given number

operations.name: get
operations.description: get the value of a key

operations.name: getObjectIdleTime
operations.description: get the OBJECT IDLE TIME

operations.name: getRange
operations.description: get the sub string of the key

operations.name: getSet
operations.description: set the string value of a key and return its old value

operations.name: incrBy
operations.description: increment the integer value of a key by the given amount

operations.name: mGet
operations.description: get the values of all given keys

operations.name: mSet
operations.description: set multiple keys to multiple values

operations.name: mSetnX
operations.description: set multiple keys to multiple values, only if none of the key exist

operations.name: set
operations.description: set the string value of a key

operations.name: setBit
operations.description: sets of clears the bit at offset in the string value stored at key

operations.name: setnX
operations.description: set the value of a key, only if the key does not exist

operations.name: setRange
operations.description: overwrite part of a string at key stating at the specified offset

operations.name: strLen
operations.description: get the length of the value stored in a key
